EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────────────
### Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network
Consists of:
• Two stone‑furnace units located at (0.0, 0.0) and (5.0, 0.0). Each furnace is paired with burner‑inserters and a wooden chest to automatically feed raw ore into smelting operations.

### Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup
Consists of:
• A burner‑mining drill at (–15.0, –50.0) that extracts iron‑ore.
• A wooden chest at (–13.5, –51.5) to collect the extracted resource.
• Transport belts linking the drill to the chest.

### Steam Power Generation System
Consists of:
• A boiler at (8.0, 20.5) which provides the necessary steam.
• A network of steam engines deployed at (0.5, 9.5), (18.5, 11.5), (1.5, 13.5), (13.5, 14.5), (19.5, 14.5), (22.5, 18.5), (17.5, 20.5), (12.5, 21.5) and (4.5, 23.5).
• An extra steam engine intended to join the network remains unplaceable due to severe congestion around the boiler area.

### Automation Research Lab
Consists of:
• A laboratory configured for processing automation science packs.
• The lab remains unpowered (status NO_POWER), awaiting proper electrical connection.

### Electrical and Transport Infrastructure
Consists of:
• Multiple interlinked Electricity Groups (composed of power poles and connection nodes) that distribute power across the base.
• Various Belt Groups and Pipe Groups ensuring connectivity for materials and fluids throughout the facility.

ERROR TIPS
─────────────────────────────
### Persistent Extra Steam Engine Placement Error
• The extra steam engine consistently fails to be placed because the area around the boiler at (8.0, 20.5) remains severely congested with overlapping burner‑inserters, transport belts, and other interfering entities.
• Recommendation: Manually inspect and clear the boiler and adjacent connection interfaces. Remove, reposition, or adjust interfering entities to create sufficient clearance. Alternatively, relocate the extra steam engine to a dedicated area away from the congested zone.

### Fuel and Source Item Shortages on Burner‑Inserters
• Multiple burner‑inserters are reporting “out of fuel” or are “waiting for source items,” disrupting their operation.
• Recommendation: Optimize fuel delivery routes and verify that inserter placement allows easy access to fuel (e.g. coal) and source items. Adjust layout where necessary to ensure a stable resource flow.

### Connectivity Gaps in the Steam Engine Network
• Several steam engines display errors such as “not connected to power network,” “no input liquid,” and “no fluid present in connections,” undermining power generation.
• Recommendation: Confirm that all connection points between the boiler, steam engines, and the fluid systems are correctly aligned and unobstructed. Reposition or clear nearby entities to restore proper connectivity.
